(n) holiday, festival: (v) to turn upside down, to go backwards
(vo) to drink a toast (lit. to dry the cup)
(vc) to leave a surplus, to be left (over)
(n) traditional Chinese lunar calendar (lit. agricultural calendar)
(n) sticky-rice dumpling wrapped in bamboo or reed leaves
(n) first month of the lunar year
(n) night of the fifteenth of the first lunar month, sweet dumplings made of sticky-rice flour
(p) particle used to emphasize the obvious [See Grammar 3.]
(vo) to wish somebody a happy Chinese New Year, to pay a Chinese New Year call
(vo) to get rich, to make a fortune
(adj) lively, buzzing with excitement, bustling with activity (of a place or scene)
